text: [Music]
she moved into my bachelor pad
she brought in the plants to kind of
make our small little apartment look
like a living space
i would like to say that i calmly
collected these plants
but that would be completely misleading
i counted 130 plants
[Music]
as the plant walls were closing in my
wife was spending more and more time
with the plants and less and less time
with me
at the same time i lost my job and i
wanted to get my amazon web services
certification hey sweetie
and i needed something to help me with
my aws studies
so i put two and two together and
thought well what if i came up with
something like a little sensor that sits
inside the plant
and monitors temperature and humidity
and light and sends the data
up into the cloud so we pobbled together
the electronics
and then it was kind of getting it from
the screen into the cloud
and so that was where aws came in
it's a toolbox with an infinite number
of tools
eventually moisture got a little low and
then my phone went off and it was a
message from the plant telling me that
it was thirsty
and we were both like that's amazing
i posted about it on linkedin and people
just started coming out of the woodwork
i realized i kind of accidentally just
started a consulting company
and so now i'm the founder of digimatic
and i'm helping my clients to navigate
their changing needs within
amazon web services
we joke all the time that she's the form
in our relationship and i'm the function
so we have a nice kind of symbiotic
relationship where she
loves taking care of the plants i love
having the plants around
one of the most gratifying things was
just kind of collaborating with my wife
and
combining her expertise with my
expertise to come up with something
greater than the sum of the parts
so that's that's kind of that
you
